hero.title: We aim to improve the security and interoperability of devices in the <0>Internet of Things (IoT)</0>.
hero.subtitle: A bachelor project at the University of Bremen.

section-two.title: Software that makes IoT security more accessible
section-two.subtitle: For this, we looked in particular at two standards for the "self-description" of IoT devices.

list.0: A <0>Manufacturer Usage Description (MUD)</0> allows devices to specify what communication authority they require, which can be used to automatically configure firewalls and other security mechanisms.
list.1: These measures can prevent undesirable as well as harmful behavior of IoT devices.
list.2: For the implementation of <0>MUD</0>, we have developed suitable components that, on the one hand, take care of the configuration, but also allow manual device management via a front end.
list.3: By means of our "Legacy-Service", older devices without <0>MUD</0> support can be taken into account aswell.

section-three.title: What about interoperability?
section-three.description: To improve interoperability, we primarily looked at the <0>Thing Descriptions (TDs)</0> of the <1>Web of Things</1> standard, which are standardized interface descriptions intended to facilitate interaction between devices and make them vendor-independent.

section-four.title: And what can be done with it?
section-four.description: Both approaches are illustrated using a weather station demonstrator that automatically finds and reads matching sensors based on their <0>TD</0>. Matching <1>MUDs</1> are used to grant the devices only the necessary communication authority in the process, which can be visualized in the frontend and adjusted if necessary.
